H.content: diamacheteon, heated combat, carry war into logoi, arguments, discourse [see SPOM p. xvii s’expliquer avec la mort, auseinanderstzen, argue, battle, come to grips w/ death]
H.linkedContent: diamacheteon, heated combat, carry war into logoi, arguments, discourse [see SPOM p. xvii s’expliquer avec la mort, auseinanderstzen, argue, battle, come to grips w/ death]

H.content: hospitality’s infinite idea should resist the law itself

AF.content: to not take account of the Freudian impression [resistance], one confirms, countersigns (archives) his theory of “repression”
AF.linkedContent: to not take account of the Freudian impression [resistance], one confirms, countersigns (archives) his theory of “repression”

POOF.content: for Aristotle, “one loves only by declaring that one loves,” science, knowledge, self-consciousness in the lover, this is incontestable: “one cannot bear witness against it without being party to it” [Derrida does have objections]
POOF.linkedContent: for Aristotle, “one loves only by declaring that one loves,” science, knowledge, self-consciousness in the lover, this is incontestable: “one cannot bear witness against it without being party to it” [Derrida does have objections]

MPM.content: de Manian criticism/deconstruction always analysis of “resistances” and symptoms they produce [i.e. “resistance to theory” in literary studies]
MPM.linkedContent: de Manian criticism/deconstruction always analysis of “resistances” and symptoms they produce [i.e. “resistance to theory” in literary studies]

SH.content: the resistance thought of “once” gives one to think, let’s let ourselves be approached by this offering
SH.linkedContent: the resistance thought of “once” gives one to think, let’s let ourselves be approached by this offering

T.content: resistance to deconstruction: infinite mastery > assurance of Being & interiorization of every limit as being, as its own proper
T.linkedContent: resistance to deconstruction: infinite mastery > assurance of Being & interiorization of every limit as being, as its own proper

FWT.content: singularity resists, remains, sometimes it even resists being assigned to “subjectivity”
FWT.linkedContent: singularity resists, remains, sometimes it even resists being assigned to “subjectivity”

OS.content: political resistance often highly “moral” alibi [re: Heidegger] for another resistance: for philosophical resistance, denegation of the text, refusal to read
OS.linkedContent: political resistance often highly “moral” alibi [re: Heidegger] for another resistance: for philosophical resistance, denegation of the text, refusal to read

ROP.content: faudrait-il résister? et d'abord à l'analyse? must analyze this “il faut”
ROP.linkedContent: faudrait-il résister? et d'abord à l'analyse? must analyze this “il faut”

ROP.content: Derrida loves French word résistance, loaded w/ pathos of his nostalgia, dreams of bombing in the ‘40s > secret of inconsolable nostalgia resists analysis, kinda like navel of dream
ROP.linkedContent: Derrida loves French word résistance, loaded w/ pathos of his nostalgia, dreams of bombing in the ‘40s > secret of inconsolable nostalgia resists analysis, kinda like navel of dream

ROP.content: a meaning that exceeds but doesn’t resist analysis: Freud’s verborgene Sinn
ROP.linkedContent: a meaning that exceeds but doesn’t resist analysis: Freud’s verborgene Sinn

ROP.content: Freud says he’s responsible for the Lösung (analysis, solution, medication) but not the resistance of the patient, patient alone is responsible for his/her resistance
ROP.linkedContent: Freud says he’s responsible for the Lösung (analysis, solution, medication) but not the resistance of the patient, patient alone is responsible for his/her resistance

ROP.content: sträuben (to stand on end, to resist), recalcitrant to treatment
ROP.linkedContent: sträuben (to stand on end, to resist), recalcitrant to treatment

ROP.content: the poleros (politics, polemos, eros, seduction) of analysis, ends in an abyss, where resistance to psychoanalytic Lösung, in the name of truth, can only be a disavowal > to analyze, to say to other: prefer, take, love my solution, you will be in truth if you do not resist my solution
ROP.linkedContent: the poleros (politics, polemos, eros, seduction) of analysis, ends in an abyss, where resistance to psychoanalytic Lösung, in the name of truth, can only be a disavowal > to analyze, to say to other: prefer, take, love my solution, you will be in truth if you do not resist my solution

ROP.content: Derrida proposes an other resistance, that of the remainder, thus a restanalysis
ROP.linkedContent: Derrida proposes an other resistance, that of the remainder, thus a restanalysis

ROP.content: is resistance (Widerstände) to analysis something that later one can interpret (Enlightenment logic, progressivism), or is it an unanalyzable darkness (fatalistic pessimism), or is it heterogenous to interpretation [resistance as the very wish of a dream]
ROP.linkedContent: is resistance (Widerstände) to analysis something that later one can interpret (Enlightenment logic, progressivism), or is it an unanalyzable darkness (fatalistic pessimism), or is it heterogenous to interpretation [resistance as the very wish of a dream]

ROP.content: psychoanalysis is in principle nonhypnotic, affirms right to resistance to hypnosis (and said resistance’s insurmountability)
ROP.linkedContent: psychoanalysis is in principle nonhypnotic, affirms right to resistance to hypnosis (and said resistance’s insurmountability)

ROP.content: it is thus the trace that resists analysis
ROP.linkedContent: it is thus the trace that resists analysis

ROP.content: violence of psychoanalysis: turn resister into “collaborator” (Freud’s words), or then deprive patient’s defenses of all value
ROP.linkedContent: violence of psychoanalysis: turn resister into “collaborator” (Freud’s words), or then deprive patient’s defenses of all value

ROP.content: royal weaver (le tisserand royal) of Platonic dialectic (then Aristotle, Hegel, Kant), belongs to order of ideational consciousness, cannot intervene to remove resistance of any sort
ROP.linkedContent: royal weaver (le tisserand royal) of Platonic dialectic (then Aristotle, Hegel, Kant), belongs to order of ideational consciousness, cannot intervene to remove resistance of any sort

ROP.content: if there is not one resistance to psychoanalysis, then there is no “la psychanalyse” > more than one psychoanalysis, resistance, for noncontingent, nonaccidental reasons
ROP.linkedContent: if there is not one resistance to psychoanalysis, then there is no “la psychanalyse” > more than one psychoanalysis, resistance, for noncontingent, nonaccidental reasons

ROP.content: Freud’s 5 resistances in “Inhibition, Symptom, Anxiety,” one of which is the ego benefiting from the illness > Derrida finds such behavior so commonplace, he wonders by what confused concept of illness this could be an interesting singularity
ROP.linkedContent: Freud’s 5 resistances in “Inhibition, Symptom, Anxiety,” one of which is the ego benefiting from the illness > Derrida finds such behavior so commonplace, he wonders by what confused concept of illness this could be an interesting singularity

ROP.content: death drive and repetition compulsion (Wiederholungszwang), hyperbolic resistance of nonresistance, “resistance of the unconscious,” thwarts working through, une résistance qui n’a pas de sens (death drive), n’est pas une résistance > [does this concept present analysis itself? is it the structure of analysis? does it fold over? upset the meaning of the series?]
ROP.linkedContent: death drive and repetition compulsion (Wiederholungszwang), hyperbolic resistance of nonresistance, “resistance of the unconscious,” thwarts working through, une résistance qui n’a pas de sens (death drive), n’est pas une résistance > [does this concept present analysis itself? is it the structure of analysis? does it fold over? upset the meaning of the series?]

ROP.content: death drive and repetition compulsion, hyperbolic resistance, as analytic, as the urge to speak, to analyze
ROP.linkedContent: death drive and repetition compulsion, hyperbolic resistance, as analytic, as the urge to speak, to analyze

ROP.content: Beyond the Pleasure Principle as site of psychoanalysis’ own resistance to itself
ROP.linkedContent: Beyond the Pleasure Principle as site of psychoanalysis’ own resistance to itself

ROP.content: pourquoi mon explication avec l’analyse [psychoanalysis] a toujours eu ce goût de mort en poste restante qui m’a poussé à rôder sans fin dans les parages de Beyond the Pleasure Principle [?]
ROP.linkedContent: pourquoi mon explication avec l’analyse [psychoanalysis] a toujours eu ce goût de mort en poste restante qui m’a poussé à rôder sans fin dans les parages de Beyond the Pleasure Principle [?]

ROP.content: to pluralize offers an emergency exit (se donner une issue de secours), until the plural kills you [re: title “Resistances”]
ROP.linkedContent: to pluralize offers an emergency exit (se donner une issue de secours), until the plural kills you [re: title “Resistances”]

ROP.content: entangled necessities: 1) resistance [to analysis] as double bind, other or outside at heart of internal auto-affective tension > it provokes analysis and dialectic to infinity, in order to resist both absolutely 2) resistance as la restance du reste, resists because la reste n’est ou n’este pas
ROP.linkedContent: entangled necessities: 1) resistance [to analysis] as double bind, other or outside at heart of internal auto-affective tension > it provokes analysis and dialectic to infinity, in order to resist both absolutely 2) resistance as la restance du reste, resists because la reste n’est ou n’este pas

ROP.content: a third path that breaks symbolic, dialectical pact (authority of the 3), that would not be a third path: the square as that which most radically resists, un dernier carré
ROP.linkedContent: a third path that breaks symbolic, dialectical pact (authority of the 3), that would not be a third path: the square as that which most radically resists, un dernier carré

ROP.content: no analytic position once resistance is not identifiable
ROP.linkedContent: no analytic position once resistance is not identifiable

ROP.content: Lacan uses trinitarian figures to give firm consistency to a resistance supérieurement organisée > letter always arrives; here proceeds division btwn 3 & 4, btwn resistance bound up in repression & la restance disséminale, no longer belonging to economy of repression
ROP.linkedContent: Lacan uses trinitarian figures to give firm consistency to a resistance supérieurement organisée > letter always arrives; here proceeds division btwn 3 & 4, btwn resistance bound up in repression & la restance disséminale, no longer belonging to economy of repression

ROP.content: death drive (repetition compulsion, fort/da), Evil Genius of Freud, the devil’s advocate, limping devil: by way of which psychoanalysis finds its speculative power & its greatest resistance
ROP.linkedContent: death drive (repetition compulsion, fort/da), Evil Genius of Freud, the devil’s advocate, limping devil: by way of which psychoanalysis finds its speculative power & its greatest resistance

DST.content: resistance indicates sensitive point (lieu sensible) in a reading > point (point) of incomprehension that organizes it
DST.linkedContent: resistance indicates sensitive point (lieu sensible) in a reading > point (point) of incomprehension that organizes it

DST.content: resistance to désistance is desire for assistance, paternal assistance, Oedipal help ——unavoidable resistance to désistance as nonpathological inhibition, no rhythm w/out it, can say the same about the double bind (see p. 228 return to father, subject to law as inhibition, defense) [a safeguarding, a filiation, a subjectivity compelled by the caesura?]
DST.linkedContent: resistance to désistance is desire for assistance, paternal assistance, Oedipal help ——unavoidable resistance to désistance as nonpathological inhibition, no rhythm w/out it, can say the same about the double bind (see p. 228 return to father, subject to law as inhibition, defense) [a safeguarding, a filiation, a subjectivity compelled by the caesura?]

PF.content: Kamuf (un)knots alibis of the concept around the major alibi: resistance
PF.linkedContent: Kamuf (un)knots alibis of the concept around the major alibi: resistance

PF.content: concept w/out concept of resistance, brought in line (after twists/turns) w/ desistance, especially restance (restance in Glas: being “nothing,” w/out substance, upsets ontological question “What is it?”—older than distinction btwn “who” and “what”)
PF.linkedContent: concept w/out concept of resistance, brought in line (after twists/turns) w/ desistance, especially restance (restance in Glas: being “nothing,” w/out substance, upsets ontological question “What is it?”—older than distinction btwn “who” and “what”)

PF.content: res(is)ts > what remains to be thought resists thought, in advance, remains in advance
PF.linkedContent: res(is)ts > what remains to be thought resists thought, in advance, remains in advance

PF.content: only know what thought means by way of what resists/remains to be thought, thought remains to be thought
PF.linkedContent: only know what thought means by way of what resists/remains to be thought, thought remains to be thought

PF.content: passivity of resistance resists thought because it does the most, the impossible as heart of possible, makes the most happen
PF.linkedContent: passivity of resistance resists thought because it does the most, the impossible as heart of possible, makes the most happen

PF.content: resistance can be praised for fighting dogma, denounced as reactive/frightened disavowal
PF.linkedContent: resistance can be praised for fighting dogma, denounced as reactive/frightened disavowal

PF.content: rhetoric of defense becomes rhetoric of accusation
PF.linkedContent: rhetoric of defense becomes rhetoric of accusation

HLP.content: Derrida likes U.S. phrase “civil disobedience” (Thoreau), that respectable tradition where raison d’état does not dispense last word in ethics
HLP.linkedContent: Derrida likes U.S. phrase “civil disobedience” (Thoreau), that respectable tradition where raison d’état does not dispense last word in ethics

HLP.content: resist positive laws (not all laws), laws that betray their own foundation
HLP.linkedContent: resist positive laws (not all laws), laws that betray their own foundation

HLP.content: Marrano: right to secrecy as right to resistance beyond order of political (or theologico-political in general)
HLP.linkedContent: Marrano: right to secrecy as right to resistance beyond order of political (or theologico-political in general)

TR.content: resistance of letter (force of resistance w/out material substance) affects body: dissociative, dismembering, disseminating [materiality w/out matter, formality w/out form]
TR.linkedContent: resistance of letter (force of resistance w/out material substance) affects body: dissociative, dismembering, disseminating [materiality w/out matter, formality w/out form]

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis has failed to say anything original about mondialisation, tele-technic virtuality—has resisted, in autoimmune fashion, changing, thinking through, fundamental axioms of ethics, law, politics > must be a revolution re: concepts cruelty, sovereignty, resistance
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis has failed to say anything original about mondialisation, tele-technic virtuality—has resisted, in autoimmune fashion, changing, thinking through, fundamental axioms of ethics, law, politics > must be a revolution re: concepts cruelty, sovereignty, resistance

TN.content: self-relation, “s’efforcer” > institutes/born to itself as exertion moment when limit insists, resists > efforcement as effort/limit, a finite force s’arrête, and se replie toward itself depuis sa fin ——objectivity of being(s): 1) exposed before a gaze 2) opposes a resistance to touch > does the hand (being-before-the-hand) reconcile these two positional values of objectivity?
TN.linkedContent: self-relation, “s’efforcer” > institutes/born to itself as exertion moment when limit insists, resists > efforcement as effort/limit, a finite force s’arrête, and se replie toward itself depuis sa fin ——objectivity of being(s): 1) exposed before a gaze 2) opposes a resistance to touch > does the hand (being-before-the-hand) reconcile these two positional values of objectivity?

TN.content: via de Biran, sense of “I” comes from hand: rough, too heavy resistance > he would know nothing about himself, if he did not experience resistance
TN.linkedContent: via de Biran, sense of “I” comes from hand: rough, too heavy resistance > he would know nothing about himself, if he did not experience resistance

UWC.content: university w/out conditions does not, in fact, exist > still, in principle, it remains ultimate place of critical resistance to dogmatism, unjust appropriation
UWC.linkedContent: university w/out conditions does not, in fact, exist > still, in principle, it remains ultimate place of critical resistance to dogmatism, unjust appropriation

UWC.content: right to deconstruction as unconditional right to ask questions—even re: the authority of the question, the interrogative form
UWC.linkedContent: right to deconstruction as unconditional right to ask questions—even re: the authority of the question, the interrogative form

UWC.content: unconditional university, resistance to indivisible sovereignty, to nation-state, to economic, media, ideological, cultural, religious powers > all that limit democracy to-come
UWC.linkedContent: unconditional university, resistance to indivisible sovereignty, to nation-state, to economic, media, ideological, cultural, religious powers > all that limit democracy to-come

UWC.content: deconstruction has privileged place in Humanities, place of irredentist resistance > principle of civil disobedience, dissidence in name of law above laws, justice of thought
UWC.linkedContent: deconstruction has privileged place in Humanities, place of irredentist resistance > principle of civil disobedience, dissidence in name of law above laws, justice of thought

UWC.content: deconstruct all determined figures sovereignty has taken throughout history
UWC.linkedContent: deconstruct all determined figures sovereignty has taken throughout history

UWC.content: university w/out conditions as a promise, pledge, a profession of faith
UWC.linkedContent: university w/out conditions as a promise, pledge, a profession of faith

EU.content: violence comes from both sides, each term of opposition marked by other side (not simply passage btwn 2 poles): law/nonlaw, writing/speech, death/life, paternal/maternal language): always 2 forces of frayage and resistance: each bearing life/death at once
EU.linkedContent: violence comes from both sides, each term of opposition marked by other side (not simply passage btwn 2 poles): law/nonlaw, writing/speech, death/life, paternal/maternal language): always 2 forces of frayage and resistance: each bearing life/death at once

EU.content: Kant at once safeguards (garantissant) most totalitarian of social forms & gives place to intransigently liberal resistance
EU.linkedContent: Kant at once safeguards (garantissant) most totalitarian of social forms & gives place to intransigently liberal resistance

SPEC.content: “transference (Übertragung)” attempts to reduce “resistances” of patient, only displaces resistance, operates a resistance, as a resistance > no legacy (legs) w/out transference > inheritance of transference, legs, legation, delegation, differance of transference
SPEC.linkedContent: “transference (Übertragung)” attempts to reduce “resistances” of patient, only displaces resistance, operates a resistance, as a resistance > no legacy (legs) w/out transference > inheritance of transference, legs, legation, delegation, differance of transference

WBH.content: resistance opposed to deconstruction same as one opposed to woman’s studies, “something sexual at stake in the resistance to deconstruction,” deconstruction successful in U.S. among homosexuals, feminists
WBH.linkedContent: resistance opposed to deconstruction same as one opposed to woman’s studies, “something sexual at stake in the resistance to deconstruction,” deconstruction successful in U.S. among homosexuals, feminists
